page.title: 11NORTH SOMERSET LEVELS.
page.content: Landscape. Flat with no outstanding features crossed by mainly straight roads occasional right angled bends high or machine cut hedges usually bordered by ditches known as rhynes. The River Brue flows east-west across the southern third of the area and the Cripps in the SW corner. The only buildings are isolated farmsteads, a few cottages at the roadside some modern houses mostly in the north. Grassmoor known as a moor, the area is grass fields divided by rhynes often obscured by hedges. Permanent Pastures. The fields are permanent grass, no ploughed fields can be seen. The grass is lush and green but rough pasture is seen in the wetter southern area. Land drainage. Rhynes drain the land to river maintaining a stable water table.
